newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares open down in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares open down in quiet trade.

text.p: The Singapore stock market fell on opening on Thursday in dull trade enlivened only by revived rumours that Parkway was a takeover target, dealers said.
"The broad market is very quiet except for old rumours surrounding Parkway has come alive again," said a dealer.
At 0237 GMT, the key Straits Times Industrials Index was down 2.86 points to 2,157.02 on a volume of just 20.38 million shares. Advances led declines by 86 to 63.
Pharmaceutical firm Parkway Holdings was rumoured to be the takeover target of the Berjaya group, which owns Pantai Hospital.
Parkway rose from the start, but then dropped Singapore $0.02 to S$4.48 at 0221 GMT on active volume of 1.46 million shares.
Another target of a takeover rumour, ANA Hotels, topped the gainers, rising S$0.26 to S$3.72.
Top volume Super Coffemix, with 2.29 million shares traded, saw an early block deal of 1.9 million shares crossed at S$0.77.
Sembawang Corp shed S$0.20 to S$6.55 after rising sharply on Tuesday on rumours it might make a takeover bid for Jurong Shipyard.
